channel.title: Posts on Mathieu @ GRAAL
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Mathieu @ GRAAL

item.title: Master
item.description: I’m delighted to stay in the realm of the GRAAL research group under the guidance of François Laviolette for my MSc in Computer Science. A new set of challenges and opportunities is forthcoming!

item.title: GRAAL
item.description: I’m glad to be part of the GRAAL research group for the summer. The group is led by François Laviolette and Mario Marchand and their interests cover machine learning and its practical applications. I’m new to machine learning, but it should be fun!

item.title: GIREF
item.description: This summer I will join the GIREF research group under the supervision of José Urquiza. Their main focus is numerical methods commonly used in engineering such as the finite element method.

item.title: RAMiCS 2017
item.description: I’m happy to announce that the paper with Jules Desharnais titled Relation as Images has been accepted at RAMiCS 2017. Therefore, I’ll be in Lyon (France) in early May to present our recent work. This paper primarily defines two basic morphological operations (dilation and erosion) on binary images using a formalism from relation algebra.

item.title: LSFM
item.description: I’m thrilled to join the LSFM research group for the summer under the supervision of Jules Desharnais. Their interests lie in languages, semantics, formal and algebraic methods. I couldn’t ask for a better first research experience!
